reviews.review_msg: I've only had him for two weeks so far but he's a joint professor teaching the course with Curzon. Between Curzon and Eldon, I find Eldon a LOTTT easier to understand. He might be a bit nervous but perhaps students should be more respectful and sympathize with him. Geesh.
I am enjoying my 102 course (with a different prof) than I did this course. If he teaches 101 again wait a semester for a different prof or you will have trouble learning anything. :( all around

i came into this class with a smile, but i left it with a :( . his midterms r messed up and his lectures on showing us formuals from the text book isnt really helpful towards out assignments, the no-forms and 4 tries on the capa really screwed me over, just try and avoid him if possible
hes the wrost teacher ever midterms dont resemble final his lectures suck and are irrelevent to the coarse NEVER TAKE HIS CLASS
Dr. Johnson is an amazing prof. Her demos and videos give so much light to such a dull subject. She is really helpful and nice when you go to her office hours, so I would really recommend doing that.

This is by far the worst class I have taken in my university career.  5% for written homework, due once a week. 5% for online homework, which you pay extra for (does she get a cut?), 5% for prelecture questions, 5% for tutorials, 5% for iclicker... It feels like you have been transported to some sort of expensive highschool.
Bad prof.  Doesnt return emails.  Seems to hate students.  Sometimes doesnt know what he is talking about.

GREAT PROF, ALL HIS ASSIGNMENT QUESTIONS APPEAR ON THE MIDTERMS AND FINALS.  TEXTBOOK ISN'T NECESSARY MAKE SURE YOU PAY CLOSE DETAIL TO LECTURE NOTES.  IF YOU ATTEND LECTURES YOU WILL GET AT LEAST A B+ IN THE COURSE.

He's a pretty good lecturer for those that are not good at physics. He spoils us students as a professor with all of his examples and notes. I would recommend taking a class with him although his tests aren't the easiest. If you understand everything you will do really well.
His lectures are always filled with experiments, and that makes it so much more interesting! His lectures are concise and he is very helpful. Funny too :)
Good Prof. He tries his best to be fair. But reading the textbook for any physics course is essential
